intro: Pilea phaeocarpa, commonly known as the black-leaf pilea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Pilea phaeocarpa is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
